tuv.seg: DARE admissions scheme for students with disabilities
Scéim iontrála DARE do mhic léinn míchumasacha
• Application procedures for students with a disability
• Gnáthaimh iarratais do mhic léinn faoi mhíchumas
There are several support systems for students with disabilities who are undertaking courses at third level
Tá roinnt córas tacaíochta ar fáil do mhic léinn míchumasacha atá ag freastal ar chúrsaí tríú leibhéal
Many third-level colleges have a disability or access service which is responsible for giving support and advice to students with disabilities - see 'How to apply' below
Soláthraíonn mórán coláistí tríú leibhéal seirbhísí míchumais nó rochtana atá freagrach as tacaíocht agus comhairle do mhic léinn míchumasacha a thabhairt – féach ‘Conas iarratas a dhéanamh’ thíos
The Association for Higher Education Access and Disability (AHEAD) is a voluntary organisation that promotes the participation of students with disabilities in third-level education
Is eagraíocht dheonach í AHEAD a spreagann daltaí míchumasacha chun páirt a ghlacadh in oideachas tríú leibhéal
The AHEAD website has a range of information about educational supports for students with disabilities at third level. There is also information about accessing college
Tá réimse eolais ar an suíomh gréasáin AHEAD maidir le tacaíocht oideachais atá ar fáil do mhic léinn míchumasach agus iad ag freastal ar oideachas tríú leibhéal
The AHEAD website also has a list of other student services
Tugann sé eolas maidir leis an seirbhísí mic léin
Telling the college about your disability
Ag insint don choláiste faoi do mhíchumas

If you have a disability, a specific learning difficulty or a significant ongoing illness, you can let the third-level institution know about it - either during the application process or at any time during your course - so that they can consider, in consultation with yourself, any specific support needs you may have in college

Má tá tú faoi mhíchumas, má tá deacracht fhoghlama sonrach agat nó má tinneas suntasach leanúnach ort, is féidir leat an institiúid tríú leibhéal a chur ar an eolas faoi - i rith an phróisis iarratais nó ag aon tráth le linn do chúrsa - ionas gur féidir leo, i gcomhairle leat féin, aon tacaíocht faoi leith gur féidir a bheith agat sa choláiste a mheas

If you choose to give this information during the application process (though you are not obliged to do this) you should tick the relevant box on your application form to the Central Applications Office (CAO)

Má roghnaíonn tú an fhaisnéis seo a thabhairt le linn an phróiseas iarratais (cé nach bhfuil dualgas ort é sin a dhéanamh) ba chóir duit tic a chur sa bhosca cuí ar d'fhoirm iarratais chuig an Lár-Oifig Iontrála (LOI)
Giving this information on the form will not adversely affect your application in any way
Ní dhéanfaidh an fhaisnéis seo a thabhairt ar an bhfoirm dochair do d'iarratas ar bhealach ar bith
In fact, it is by ticking this box that you get the option of the Disability Access Route to Education - see below
Go deimhin, is trí tic a chur sa bhosca seo a fhaigheann tú an rogha an Bhealach Rochtana Míchumais ar Oideachas - féach thíos
Application procedures for students with a disability
Gnáthaimh iarratais do mhic léinn faoi mhíchumas

The Disability Access Route to Education (DARE) aims to improve access to college for school-leavers with a disability or specific learning difficulty by allocating a number of third-level places to them on a reduced points basis

Is scéim iontrála do mhic léinn faoi mhíchumas é an Bealach Rochtana ar Oideachas do Dhaoine faoi Mhíchumas (DARE). Díríonn an scéim ar rochtain ar an gcoláiste a fheabhsú do lucht fágála scoile a bhfuil míchumas orthu
To be eligible for the scheme you must provide evidence that your disability has affected your educational performance significantly – see ‘Supplementary Information Form’ below
Le bheith incháilithe don scéim ní mór duit fianaise a sholáthar go raibh tionchar suntasach ag do mhíchumas ar d’fheidhmíocht oideachais – féach ‘an Fhoirm um Eolas Forlíontach’ thíos
You must also be aged under 23 on 1 January 2017
Ní mór duit a bheith faoi bhun 23 bliana d'aois ar 1 Eanáir 2017 freisin
How the scheme works
Mar a oibríonn an scéim
Each of the third-level colleges participating in the scheme has reserved a number of course places for school-leavers who are eligible for DARE
Tá roinnt áiteanna coinnithe ag gach coláiste tríú leibhéal atá rannpháirteach sa scéim do lucht fágála scoile atá incháilithe do DARE
You can find details of the places available through DARE on the websites of the participating third-level colleges
Féadfaidh tú sonraí a fháil faoi áiteanna atá ar fáil trí DARE ar láithreáin ghréasáin na gcoláistí tríú leibhéal atá rannpháirteach
You apply for DARE through the Central Applications Office (CAO) – see ‘How to apply’ below
Déantar iarratas ar DARE tríd an Lár-Ionad Iontrála (CAO) – féach 'Conas iarratas a dhéanamh’ thíos
Once you have been accepted as eligible for DARE, you then compete for the reduced point places based on your Leaving Certificate results
Nuair a ghlactar leis go bhfuil tú incháilithe do DARE, bíonn comórtas ann don líon áiteanna ar phointí laghdaithe bunaithe ar thorthaí na hArdteistiméireachta
A reduced point place means that you may get a place on a third-level course with fewer than the full CAO points
Ciallaíonn áit le ‘pointí laghdaithe’ go bhféadfá áit a fháil ar chúrsa tríú leibhéal gan na pointí iomlána don CAO a bhaint amach
For example, if you are eligible for DARE and you get 350 Leaving Certificate points, you may be offered a place on a course that requires 360 points through the standard CAO procedure
Mar shampla, má tá tú incháilithe do DARE agus má bhaineann tú 350 pointe amach san Ardteistiméireacht, d’fhéadfaí áit ar chúrsa 360 pointe a thairiscint duit tríd an CAO
However, you must meet the college matriculation requirements and any specific course entry requirements
Mar sin féin, caithfear máithreánach an choláiste agus riachtanais iontrála ar leith an chúrsa a chomhlíonadh
Whether you apply for college through DARE or through the standard CAO procedure, there is a range of supports for student with disabilities while they are at college
Cibé an gcuireann tú iarratas isteach ar choláiste trí DARE nó trí ghnáthnós imeachta an CAO, tá raon tacaíochtaí do mhic léinn a bhfuil míchumais orthu, fad is atá siad sa choláiste
The supports available vary from college to college but may include: an orientation programme; study skills and extra tuition if required; access to assistive technology and training; mentoring

Bíonn tacaíochtaí éagsúla ar fáil ó choláiste go coláiste ach ina measc bíonn: clár ionduchtaithe; scileanna staidéir agus teagasc breise más gá; rochtain ar theicneolaíocht oiriúnaitheach agus oiliúint; meantóireacht
To be eligible for DARE you must provide additional information on the Supplementary Information Form (SIF)
Le bheith incháilithe le haghaidh BRODM ní mór duit eolas breise a sholáthar ar an bhFoirm um Eolas Forlíontach
If you tick the box on the online CAO form that asks if you have a disability or specific learning difficulty, you will be directed to the online Supplementary Information Form

Má chuireann tú tic sa bhosca ar an bhfoirm LOI ar líne a iarrann ort má tá tú faoi mhíchumas nó má tá deacracht foghlama sonrach agat, beidh tú stiúraithe chuig an bhFoirm Forlíontach Faisnéise ar líne
If you are making a paper application, you can request a paper version of the Supplementary Information Form
Má tá tú ag déanamh iarratas ar pháipéar, is féidir leat iarradh ar leagan páipéir den Fhoirm um Fhaisnéis Forlíontach
The form has 3 sections as follows:
Tá trí alt ann mar seo a leanas:
• Section A asks for information on your disability and if you wish to be considered for DARE
• Iarrann AltA le haghaidh eolas mar gheall ar do mhíchumas. Iarrann sé má tá tú ag iarraidh a bheith meastaithe le haghaidh BRODM
• Section B is a Educational Impact Statement, to be completed by your school
• Is Ráiteas Tionchair Oideachais (pdf) é Alt B atá le bheith comhlánaithe ag do scoil
It provides information about your educational experience and assists the decision about the third-level supports you need
Tugann sé eolas faoi do thaithí oideachais agus cabhraíonn sé cinneadh a dhéanamh maidir leis na tacaíochtaí tríú-leibhéal a theastaíonn uait
• Section C is Evidence of Disability which must be completed by the accepted medical consultant or specialist for your particular disability
• Is foirm um eolas ar mhíchumas (pdf) é Alt C atá le bheith comhlánaithe ag saineolaí nó comhairleoir míochaine inghlactha do do mhíchumas ar leith
It provides verification of your disability and helps the decision about the third-level supports that you need
Tugann sé seo fíorú ar do mhíchumas agus cabhraíonn sé cinneadh a dhéanamh maidir leis na tacaíochtaí tríú leibhéal a theastaíonn uait
Supports for students with disabilities
Tacaíocht do mhic léinn faoi mhíchumas

If you have indicated on your CAO form that you have a disability or specific learning difficulty, the college's Disability Service will be informed as soon as you accept a place, and they will get in touch with you to work out what supports they can provide

Má chuir tú in iúl ar d’fhoirm LOI go bhfuil tú faoi mhíchumas nó go bhfuil deacracht foghlama ar leith, cuirfear Seirbhís Mhíchumas an choláiste ar an eolas chomh luath agus a ghlacann tú le háit, agus beidh siad i dteagmháil leat chun na tacaíochtaí gur féidir leo a chur ar fáil a oibriú amach
Even if you didn't tick this box on the CAO form, you can still access the available supports by contacting the college's Disability Service at any stage during your time in college

Fiú más rud é nár chuir tú tic sa bhosca seo ar an bhfoirm LOI, is féidir leat rochtain a fháil ar na tacaíochtaí atá ar fáil trí theagmháil a dhéanamh le Seirbhís Mhíchumas an choláiste ag tráth ar bith le linn do chuid ama sa choláiste
If you wish to apply for a college place under the DARE scheme you should apply through the Central Applications Office (CAO)
Más mian leat iarratas a dhéanamh ar áit choláiste faoin scéim BRODM ba chóir duit iarratas a dhéanamh tríd an Lár-Oifig Iontrála (LOI)
When you are filling in the CAO form online you must complete the part of the form to say that you have a disability or specific learning difficulty
Nuair atá tú ag líonadh isteach an fhoirm LOI ar líne ní mór duit an chuid den fhoirm a líonadh chun a rá go bhfuil tú faoi mhíchumas nó go bhfuil deacracht shonrach foghlama agat
You will then be directed to the separate online Supplementary Information Form
Beidh tú atreoraithe ansin chuig Foirm Forlíontach Faisnéise eile ar líne
If you prefer, you can contact the CAO and ask for paper versions of the main form and the Supplementary Information Form
Más mian leat, is féidir leat teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an LOI agus iarradh orthu leaganacha páipéir den phríomhfhoirm agus den Fhoirm Fhaisnéise Forlíontach a fháil
Sections B and C can only be sent to the CAO in paper form
Ní féidir le Ranna B agus C a bheith seolta chuig an LOI i bhfoirm pháipéar amháin
The CAO advises all students to get a certificate of posting when sending documents by post
Molann an LOI do gach mac léinn teastas postála a fháil agus cáipéis á sheoladh tríd an bpost
Key dates for 2017 applications using DARE
Príomhdátaí iarratais le haghaidh 2017 ag baint úsáide as BRODM
4 November 2016 - the online CAO application facility for 2017 opens
4 Samhain 2016 - osclaíonn an CAO áis iarratas ar líne le haghaidh 2015 ag meán lae
1 February 2017 - your main application (online or paper) must reach the CAO by 5.15 p.m
1 Feabhra 2017 - ní mór do phríomhiarratas (ar líne nó ar pháipéar) a bheith ag an LOI ag 5:15 i.n
1 March 2017 - the following 3 items must reach the CAO by 5.15 p.m
1 Márta 2017 - ní mór na trí mhír seo a leanas a bheith ag an LOI roimh 5.15i.n
• Tick the box on the main CAO form that indicates you have a disability or specific learning difficulty
• Cuir tic sa bhosca ar an bpríomhfhoirm LOI a chuireann in iúl go bhfuil tú faoi mhíchumas nó go bhfuil deacracht foghlama sonrach agat
• Complete Section A of the Supplementary Information Form
• Comhlánaigh Cuid A den Fhoirm Eolais Forlíontach
• Indicate that you wish to be considered for DARE by ticking 'Yes' on question 1
• Cuir in iúl gur mian leat a bheith curtha san áireamh do BRODM trí tic a chur sa bhosca 'Sea ', ar cheist 1
1 April 2017, the rest of the Supplementary Information Form must reach the CAO by 5.15 p.m
1 Aibreán 2017 - ní mór an chuid eile den Fhoirm Eolais Forlíontach a bheith ag an LOI ag 5:15 i.n
• Section B (the Educational Impact Statement)
• Cuid B (Ráiteas Tionchair Oideachais)
No applications will be accepted after these closing dates
Ní ghlacfar le haon iarratais tar éis na dátaí deireanacha seo
The closing dates are very strict because DARE is an additional application procedure which needs extra processing time
Tá na dátaí deireanacha an-dian de bhrí go bhfuil BRODM ina nós imeachta iarratais breise atá am próiseála breise ag teastáil uaidh
You be notified by post by the end of June 2017 (after the Leaving Certificate exam) telling you whether you are eligible for the DARE scheme
Gheobhaidh tú litir i mí an Mheithimh déanaigh 2017 (tar éis scrúdú na hArdteistiméireachta) ag insint duit cibé an bhfuil tú incháilithe don scéim BRODM
If you are told you are not eligible you can ask for your application to be reviewed
Má dheirtear leat nach bhfuil tú incháilithe is féidir leat iarradh ar athbhreithniú
If you are not eligible for DARE you can still get into college if you meet the entry requirements for your chosen course
Mura bhfuil tú incháilithe le haghaidh BRODM is féidir leat freastal ar an gcoláiste má chomhlíonann tú na riachtanais iontrála le haghaidh do rogha cúrsa
The CAO helpline at (091) 509 800 can help you with your DARE application
Is féidir le líne chabhrach LOI ag (091) 509800 cabhrú leat le d'iarratas BRODM
You can find further information in this list of frequently asked questions on the Access College website
Is féidir leat tuilleadh eolais a fháil sa liosta ceisteanna seo a chuirtear go minic seo ar láithreán gréasáin an Choláiste Rochtana
You can also contact the access services of the colleges participating in the DARE scheme
Is féidir leat teagmháil a dhéanamh freisin le seirbhísí rochtana na gcoláistí atá rannpháirteach sa scéim BRODM
The DARE programme runs nationwide information sessions for students and their parents/guardians to deal with queries about preparing the application
Eagraíonn an clár náisiúnta BRODM seisiúin eolais do mhic léinn agus dá dtuismitheoirí/gcaomhnóirí chun déileáil le ceisteanna maidir leis an iarratas a ullmhú
You can download a detailed Application Guide (pdf) and checklist (pdf) to help with your application
Is féidir leat Treoir Iarratais mhionsonraithe (pdf) agus seicliosta (pdf) a íoslódáil chun cabhrú le d'iarratas
You can also access information about DARE on Facebook
Is féidir leat teacht ar eolas freisin faoi BRODM ar Facebook
